document_data.name: Nosferatu
document_data.mainbody: '''Nosferatu''' ({{SingPl}}) were a strain of [[vampire]] originating from the [[Domains of Dread]] that exhibited a degree of variance in their supernatural nature.
document_data.Description:
Nosferatu exhibited gaunt faces, that was cold to the touch, and eyes that glowed with an unholy light. Though they could appear flushed and warm to the touch, just as how they did when alive, for several hours after feeding.

Some nosferatu exhibited fierce claws, or were incapable of casting a shadow or reflection. Furthermore, some sources claimed a nosferatu often grew more attractive with the passing of centuries, their bodies becoming gradually smoother, and that the oldest of them exhibited skin comparable to [[porcelain]] in their smoothness.
document_data.Personality: Some were said to have rather high or genius intellects, capable of mastering languages over the course of their unlife, whilst other nosferatu were only semi-intelligent savage brutes. The latter were said to attain a state of lucidity following feeding.

Abilities.Weaknesses:
Nosferatu also suffered all the same weaknesses as a common vampire, and running water. Some nosferatu fell into death-like comas at sunrise, whilst others did not. For some nosferatu [[sunlight]] was not fatal, only weakening, causing their powers to become inactive. And if caught in a ''shapechanged'' form at daybreak, a nosferatu would be trapped in that form until their powers returned. For these same nosferatu it was said that exposure to direct moonlight enabled greater regenerative capabilities, allowing them to even reattach severed limbs.

A [[stake]] through the heart would slay a nosferatu, though it would come back to life upon the stake's removal unless further actions were taken with the body. This required either burning the body or severing and scattering its limbs far from the reach of the nosferatu's minions.

document_data.Combat: Some nosferatu fought with the use of their claws, whilst others were seen to fight with weaponry, even magical weaponry such as ''+1 [[rapier]]s'', and exceptional nosferatu were even seen to utilize [[spell]]s. Some claimed nosferatu only ever attacked those who were weak or ''charmed'' by them.
document_data.History: Sometime around the {{YearlinkName|1371}},{{LCRB}} an evil [[mage]] in [[the Vast]] by the name of [[Kimber]] attracted the attention of the [[Dark Powers]] of Ravenloft after creating a [[demiplane|demi-dimension]]. Intrigued by what might occur, they decided to open a [[portal]] between the Domains of Dread and [[Toril]], allowing a vampire through to aid the sorceress in her plans.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/The "Life" of the Party|3}} A [[drow vampire]] by the name of [[Johnathon Freid]] came through and eagerly acquiesced to aiding Kimber's plans of revenge, later bringing through a nosferatu by the name of [[Victoria Freid]].<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/The "Life" of the Party|14-15}}<ref group="note" name="strain">It is not explicitly stated in the adventure ''The "Life" of the Party'' where Victoria Freid came from. The adventure only explicitly states that Johnathon Freid crossed over from Ravenloft and infected ten members of [[Ravens Bluff]]'s [[City Guard (Ravens Bluff)|City Guard]] with vampirism. Due to their shared surname, as well as the adventure featuring eight basic vampires and two [[vorlog]]s, it stands to reason that Victoria was not one of these ten guards and must have been brought in off-screen.
document_data.Notable Nosferatu: * [[Jander Sunstar]], a [[gold elf]] vampire from [[Evermeet]] and one of the top experts on vampires in the Domains of Dread, was according to some sources a variant of the nosferatu strain.

Society.Diet: Nosferatu had a far greater dependence upon blood for subsistence than the common vampire, bordering on addiction, growing hungrier with each passing night. If deprived of food for long enough, a nosferatu was liable to go into a frenzy upon any viable victim that came within {{SI|40|ft|long=yes}} of them. They were able to subsist upon animal blood for a time, though they could not completely forgo humanoid blood, as living off the blood of animals would leave nosferatu in a weakened state.
Society.Languages: Like most vampires, nosferatu retained all the languages that they had known in life prior to becoming undead.
